Once upon i found this 5.00-M33 popsloader that helped me to play both parts of Parasite Eve and original FFVII. So i suggest you to try update your firmware to 5.00-M33 at least. This game is claimed to be playable on it. And try this popsloader:

I know about the Parasite Eve eboot problems as well and a hand full of others. I tried the popsloader you are speaking of and the twisted metal games will play but with no background music. TM2,TM3 and TM4 and I am pretty sure Head On has audio problems as well.

did you find a working copy for this game and mimana iyar chronicles? we have the cfw.
we have the same cfw.*

mylifsux, mate, i've downloaded TM2, TM3 and TM4 from here:

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4490233/(PSX-PSP)_Twisted_Metal_1-4_Small_Brawl_converted_properly(Kingd

tested all of them on my 5.50 GEN-D3. All games play background music, so i assume there is nothing to worry about. I'm using popsloader that i posted above with pops version set to 4.01 M33 (probably similiar to your firmware).

P.S.: Also i've tried this release of TM2:

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4511935/PSX_PS1_PSOne_Twisted_Metal_2

and it doesn't play background music on both the PC-emulator and PSP. So i assume it is also a matter of proper game-image.

P.S.2: One day i understood that the update is inevitable if i want to play upcoming games. It's up to you now. Good luck.

what do you mean by the root of your memory stick? and is this the full version. with movies and such?

Root directory is a basic top-level directory of the data storage device that contains all the other files and folders. Here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Root_directory
And yes - this is full version with movie-cutscenes and all that must be there.
"Root is a root directory of your Memory Stick. At my pc Memory Stick locates at letter G. So the root directory for drive G will be G:\."
